alert.note: Alert for Bent; Crowley; Kiowa; Otero (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 06 at 12:59AM MDT until July 06 at 2:15AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM MDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR NORTHERN BENT, CROWLEY, SOUTHWESTERN KIOWA AND NORTHERN OTERO COUNTIES... At 1259 AM MDT, The widespread heavy rain has ended. However, flooding is likely still occurring over the greater Highway 50 corridor, especially the county roadways and local city streets. Please use extreme caution if traveling tonight and do not cross flooded roadways. Through the rest of tonight, there will be the potential for brief heavy rain showers, but no widespread heavy rain is anticipated. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... La Junta, North La Junta, Rocky Ford, Las Animas, Fowler, Ordway, Swink, Manzanola, Olney Springs, Sugar City, Cheraw, Crowley, Haswell, Arlington, Blue Lake, John Martin Reservoir, Hasty, McClave, Fort Lyon and Caddoa. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
